title.narrative: 003 IN SCHOOL AND LEARNING

description.narrative: By 2025, improved capacity of schools to effectively deliver the primary and lower secondary education curriculum, with a particular focus on disadvantaged woredas., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 'By 2025, girls and boys in Ethiopia, in particular the most disadvantaged and those affected by humanitarian situations, benefit from an equitable and resilient education system enabling them to acquire relevant knowledge and skills.

participating-org.narrative: B GUMUZ REGIONAL EDUCATION BUREAU REB

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2025, improved capacity of schools to effectively deliver the primary and lower secondary education curriculum, with aparticular focus on disadvantaged woredas.

description.narrative: Capacity-building of 3,266 (2,701 male and 565 female) Teaching and Learning Materials (TLM) developers and evaluators took the TLM training which was drawn from universities and MoE and REB curriculum experts to bring quality assurance of curriculum TLMs through UNICEF financial and technical support to the Ministry of Education’s General Education Curriculum reform. Such reform has the potential to improve learning outcomes for students once it is piloted and implemented. Life skills materials were successfully prepared and distributed, and training workshops were undertaken, which benefitted 186,139 girls and boys in development and humanitarian contexts. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:08/01/2022
